page.title: 18SOIL AND WATER
page.content: We carried out an acidity test on the soil in our area. We found that on Gleniffer Braes at the southern end of the country park the acidity is quite high (ph5), at the Stanely water treatment works on the lower slopes to the north the soil registers ph6.5 and at the very foot of the Braes the ph is 7. This indicates that the soil is more acidic the higher up you go and has less potential. Tests were carried out on the water quality of Glen Burn.We took water from the burn in the Glen Park. It appeared clean and smelled fresh. It had a ph value of 6. Another sample was taken downstream at Donaldswood. This water although it appeared quite clean had a ph of 5 indicating more acidity.
